author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Operation New Uniform helps active-duty servicemembers transition into new careers
text:
Summary by Ground News Operation New Uniform was founded in 2013 to help transitioning servicemembers find their "new uniform," their new career in the business world. The Jacksonville-based company, Swisher, committed $50,000 to sponsor the training of 14 Jacksonville-area military members. The Veterans of Valor Employee Resource Group will launch in 2023. author: Reuters
title: Palm oil eases on soft rival oils, heads for weekly loss - Markets - Business Recorder
text: SINGAPORE: Malaysian palm oil futures fell on Friday amid lower edible and crude oil prices, with the market set for a weekly decline, although a weaker ringgit limited losses. The benchmark palm oil contract for June delivery on the Bursa Malaysia Derivatives Exchange fell 21 ringgit, or 0.49% to 4,228 ringgit ($892.36) a metric ton in morning trade. Malaysian palm oil futures easier It had slid 0.19% during overnight trade. The contract is set for a weekly loss of about 1%. Fundamentals - contract was down 0.86%. Soyoil prices on the Chicago Board of Trade lost 0.74%. - Palm oil is affected by price movements in related oils as they compete for a share in the global vegetable oils market. - Oil prices sank on the possibility of a nearing Gaza ceasefire, which could ease geopolitical concerns in the Middle East, at the same time a stronger US dollar and faltering US gasoline demand weighed on prices. - Weaker crude oil futures make palm a less attractive option for biodiesel feedstock. - The Malaysian ringgit, palm’s currency of trade, weakened 0.55% against the dollar. A weaker ringgit makes palm oil more attractive for foreign currency holders. - Palm oil may retrace into the 4,190-4,212 ringgit range again, following its failure to break resistance at 4,326 ringgit per ton, said Reuters technical analyst Wang Tao.
